g.text: Create DPoP Key Pair (for Token Exchange)
Session-based Key Pair for DPoP binding.
The attestation_challenge is a cryptographic hash
of the Public Client Instance Key Hash and a nonce.
It is used to bind the attestation to the client instance.
The Primärsystem (PS) and the ZETA Attestation Service (ZTA) are
in the same trust domain. At the time of client installation, the ZTA
computes a cryptographic hash of the PS software and extends this
hash into a specific PCR (22 or 23) using TPM2_PCR_Extend. The
ZTA reads and stores the resulting PCR value as a reference
measurement or baseline. At every start of the PS, the ZTA measures
the PS software and extends the resulting hash into the same PCR
[ZETA TPM Service has no TPM Attestation Key]
Store AK Handle, AK Public Key
Client Instance Public Keys und die Nonce.
PCR 7: Secure Boot State / Policy, Digest
PCR 22 or 23 (if available) App Data, Digest
"sub": "<Telematik-ID from SM(C)-B>", // Subject is the institution
Add JWT-Signature to SM(C)-B ID Token
Create DPoP Proof JWT for Token Exchange
DPoP Proof JWT Claims (for Token Exchange):
Create Client Assertion JWT without Attestation
Create DPoP Proof JWT for Token Exchange
Get Client Data, Session Data, User Data
Client Data, Session Data, User Data
